The Dawson is a high-end American restaurant that provides excellent service, food, and cocktails at a rather not affordable price, but I'm ok with that because the quality of the service, ingredients, and decor makes it worth your money. All the food dishes I've tried here so far have been made to perfection. The salmon I ordered was crisp, light, and flavorful. My beloved GTO is strong, sweet, and thyme-infused with gin. The service is the best I've had in Chicago: from the bartender to the waiter to the hostess, everyone is incredibly friendly and always smiling.

If you want to take your date to a nice restaurant to dine in, I highly recommend checking the Dawson out.

If you want to take

Going to agree with basically everyone that the patio is perfect.

I was disappointed in my chicken fried lobster! I ordered it because it's something I wouldn't make at home, and I thought it lacked excitement. It's cool and different, but wasn't amazing. I will say that the breading outside was perfectly crispy, though.

The mac and cheese is AMAZING. I'm not a huge bacon fan, but the bacon in this is the perfect compliment. It's thick too, which I am a big fan of. The only thing is that you have to eat it kind of fast if you don't want the cheese to congeal/solidify at all. It's also very rich, IMO, so that might be difficult to accomplish on your own. Just make sure to sit with a friend who is happy to swipe a couple of bites to help you out...unless you're a hungry bear, then go to town!

Great atmosphere! Ken the manager was so nice. The patio was a chill place to hang out with friends. Go to the back where there is a fireplace and sofas to sit and drink. The atmosphere is amazing. I like how there is an outside and inside area so you can walk around.

Great ambience, great music (which kinda threw me off - wasn't expecting throwback hip hop and R&B but I appreciated it), great food. I recently tried the fried chicken lobster, mac n cheese (minus bacon), and garlic mash. The lobster was amazing, and the spicy ranch had a nice kick. I split the sides with my bestie (I'd say the sides are big enough for 2 adults) and enjoyed those too... after adding a little salt and pepper.

The only thing I didn't like was my drink. I asked our waiter for his recommendation on a sweet drink and he pointed me to the "majority rule." It was so disgusting and super tart. Even sprite and grenadine couldn't help!

Come here regularly but finally realizing that there's not much more to it than the atmosphere.

Unfortunately, my last few visits have been less than satisfying with slow, rude servers and inconsistent food. Although they do have outstanding cocktails, I will give them that! But the servers either don't leave you alone, or they go missing during their shift! As for the food.... it is salty, over cooked and they need to switch up their menu.

Bravo Dawson

Food:
"Avocado Toast " may sound boring and simple but it was far from that. The creamy avocado was taken to the next level by pairing it with an over-easy egg.The dish sent an " Taste Too Damn Good" alert to my taste receptors.

Drinks:
"Insanely Beautiful" was the name of my drink. The perfectly titled drink, made me feel insanely beautiful after I was done. Great drink , lots of flavor and perfectly sweet.

pics.caption: Avocado Toast! Picture taken by Dinah Ro

review.des: This review is for the arsehole valets who park cars blocking the right hand turn lane in rush hour backing traffic up for two blocks and then laugh and point at the frustrated motorists, often leaving the car doors open while casually chatting in the middle of the street with the drivers creating even more traffic havoc while sardonically smiling at the very frustrated motorists.  If these are the kind of Richardheads they hire, then they'll never get any of my money or my considerable client expense funds.  Or maybe I'm just not douchey enough to think screwing over other people is at all funny.  This has happened more than once, so it's a pattern, not a one time occurrence.  There are too many other great places in Chicago to spend my money to associating with a place like this.  I'LL PASS.

My review for the Dawson is long long long overdue. I visited the Dawson on Nov. 5, 2016 with some friends in the area and we had a delicious brunch.

While my fiance and I were in Chicago for the Rugby Weekend I knew I wanted to treat him to a good birthday brunch since it was in fact his birthday weekend. I asked a friend in the area to recommend a place for brunch and she told me to check out the Dawson and I am so glad she did! Just looking at the reviews and pictures I knew I had to try the food.

My friend made a reservation for 4 on a Saturday around 11. When we arrived the place wasn't too packed and they had the table ready for us. The server came over and introduced herself to us and made a few suggestions for drinks and appetizers! Yes, appetizers for brunch! She recommended the pumpkin pie because at the Dawson they do dessert first! My friend and I totally ordered it too. We also ordered the bacon flight (4 kinds of bacon) to share as a table (but not me since I don't eat bacon). We also each ordered some beverages to start the day. Our drinks were brought over quickly and tasted great. By the time she brought our appetizers over we all needed another round of drinks. The best part? They added a candle to the bacon flight and we were able to sign happy birthday to my fiance. I am sure that embarrassed him a little, but whatever-it was fun!

The pumpkin pie was so good and the rest of the group enjoyed the bacon. I don't think they ate it all, but they ate enough of it to say that the bacon was all tasty and delicious. Once our server brought our 2nd round of drinks we were ready to order. I ordered the avocado toast because the reviews for it made this toast sound heavenly. I really can't remember what else was ordered, but I think someone ordered a burger and I am pretty sure someone had a B.E.A.L.T sandwich. All I know is that there was a ton of food on the table when it was all delivered. The plated presentations of the food was eye-candy for me. It was almost a shame to start eating to mess up the art-work.

Long story short, we were at the Dawson for about 2.5 hours and had a blast! Our server was incredible and friendly. The bartender made some great drinks (we even opted to take a shot of something at one point; it was the daily drip). It was a delicious brunch with delicious food. I really do want to go back next time I go to Chicago. I can't stop thinking about their avocado toast! When it was time to pay the check we just decided to split it 4 ways so that there wasn't any confusion with who had what and who was going to pay for what...it was just easier to split it 4 ways. Thankfully the group I was with was completely okay with that. I'm not sure if they do split checks since we didn't ask.

Of course, it's nice to also let you know that the bathroom is downstairs if you need it. I had a bit of a hard time finding it, but I saw the hostess and she pointed me in the right direction. I'm sure they get asked all the time where it is.

Overall, this is a great spot for brunch and I bet they have a great lunch and dinner service too. I do recommend you check it out when you are in the area. It's worth it-trust me!

This restaurant definitely has a very romantic vibe going for it, with the dim candle-lit space. This week they were celebrating the 90s with various, 90s inspired drinks. I had "da bomb" which was a delicious, well-balanced margarita. For dinner I ordered the fried chicken. Was it amazing? No. Was it good? Yeah. The chicken skin was nice and crispy, but the standout was the coleslaw which had a hint of spice. The French onion sauce was very salty and not very pleasant. Don't order this on a first date, gets real messy! The hanger steak was well cooked, but lacked any real umph, real taste to it, but the accompanying polenta was good.

Overall, a nice date night restaurant with great drinks and average food. Our waiter was not very attentive, but the ambiance was nice. 3.5 stars
A local spot for us - always enjoy The Dawson and consistent in quality. Outdoor patio is fantastic when it's summertime.  Never had a bad experience here.

We had a really wonderful Sunday brunch here, and our server Tim took great care of us. I got the brussels sprouts hash per his recommendation, which was delicious, and we were also really blown away by the cinnamon bun and bacon flight we ordered for the table. Probably the only downside to our entire experience was when a live band started playing around 4 or 5 and suddenly our table couldn't hear each other speak. But overall we had a great experience and would return.

I'm struggling with this review. Overall I give it a 3.5. Let me break it down for you.

Drinks, Ambiance 5 stars. Drinks are great here. The ambiance is very lovely. If you want to take a date, they have an upstairs which is really chill. It's intimate, romantic, and they blast some old school 90's music to mix things up. No joke, really cool place, no a GREAT place to take a date. For drinks I got the eat my shorts dude. If you like whiskey/scotch and any sort of rendition for an Old Fashion, this is a great drink. I liked it a lot. Also got the Talk to the Hand. This was an interesting drink. It's definitely for those who like to sip on scotch/whiskey, the lavender was an interesting smell to the drink. Overall I liked the drinks I got a lot.

Food, the food is where this review is hard for me. We got the mussels. If we only got the mussels, this place would be 4-5 stars. The mussels with the soup base was GREAT. And when you dip it with the toast they provide it's phenomenal. However, I wish they would take a look at the toast as some of the bread was burnt. Yuck. But I can't complain, they provide more toast for you if you like. We also got the mix grill. This part of the dinner was a bit pricey. It was $30 for the dish and it was mostly sausage. Last I remembered, sausage isn't that expensive. There is two meat skewers that were included as well, but half of the skewers were burnt. Whoever was running the kitchen that night liked to burn the food that night. The Mac and Cheese as a side was extremely underwhelming. I felt like a box of Kraft Mac and Cheese was opened without the cheese sauce and Parmesan was sprinkled on the top.

Overall like I said in the beginning the ambiance/drinks were great. The food? Not so much. Maybe I came in a bad day or maybe it is what it is.

pics.caption: The eat my shorts dude drink is phenomenal!
The mix grill. Some burnt meat. Sausages for $30. Eh. And the mac and cheese. Very underwhelming. Tasted like out of a box.
Talk to the hand. Solid drink if you like whiskey scotch kind of drinks.

review.des:
I met a friend for brunch early on a Saturday morning. The ambiance is fantastic, very hip, dark decor, which we loved!

Drinks:
-Gin & Tonic with Rosemary: refreshing and delicious
-Irish Coffee: strong, not too sweet

Food:
We both ordered the brussels sprouts hash with the chicken sausage. Could have done without the sausage patty, just didn't love it, but otherwise, this dish was amazing! The egg was perfectly poached and the combination of spices and vegetables was perfection! Could not more highly recommend this dish.

Service:
Average. Our waiter wasn't very attentive, but we were chatting, so didn't mind too much. We always had water though- the staff was fantastic about that!

Lovey place. Amazing patio for the summer with a wood burning outdoor fireplace that you can smell as you sit outside.

The service is great, the ambiance is amazing, they almost always offer us champagne! And the food is great.

We had the fish tacos which is a shareable dish (good for 3 people) and the fried chicken (generous portion). Both are impressive.

The Dawson is also kid friendly - they have high chairs and mac and cheese for kids, and they accommodate big groups.

Beautiful place, delicious food and good service.
Ordered mussels, fried lobster and vegan salad, all appetizer but easily feed two people.
Mussels come in a very large portion. I like their coconut milk idea, kind of rich, but much better than the regular red or wine sauce.
Fried lobster is okay, I am not a fan of fried food, but my husband like it a lot.
Make sure to get Stiegl Radner, I could drink it every day.

pics.caption: Lobster half way, very large portion.

review.des: This is what I expected after a long day of working. The drinks are unreal and the food had great flavors I can't believe I found this using my phone to find some burgers but I found so much more. Try the return to your roots drink you won't be sorry. Hats off and thanks for keeping the historic charm.

Gosh, I was really hoping for a great experience here.

Let's begin... and I left just 2 hours ago. First, I called to reschedule my reservation due to my train station being closed and they were accommodating. Not a big deal. I finally arrived and one of my friends was already there. There were 3 ladies today, and sorry, one girl was running super late... but still, half of the tables in the patio area were not occupied, so I don't think we upset the staff too much.

While we waited, I went down to the restroom. It was a total mess. 3 of the 4 stalls were not flushed. 2 of the 4 stalls did not have toilet paper. On top of it, no paper towels. Ok, no big deal... I told the hostess in the front. This stuff happens. Maybe there was a herd of sloppy drunk ladies. I told the hostess up front and she apologized so many times for that.

Shortly, the hostess took us to our seats. We saw two open tables in the front under the shade, which were open the entire time we waited. She was about to seat us on one of the tables, but hesitated. She offered for us to sit under an umbrella. We followed her, to sit in the middle of the patio, which there were no umbrellas and have only two seats. Oh my goodness... I was so confused like the hostess. She mentioned we would be reseated. Ok?

Five minutes later, I had enough. I went to the front to go back and sit there, so our third friend would not be confused when she came. She actually arrived then, and was confused. I complained a little to one of the guys in front, and to the same hostess.. just to nudge them, but I didn't get a single apology. Maybe this is their normal seating process -- to seat the guests anywhere until you give them their final seat. Anyway, we finally got seated at the same table we ALMOST got seated in, until the hostess took us to the table for 2.

As for the food, it was ok. We ordered the following:

1. Chicken fried lobster - It's lobster tails fried like fried chicken... with similar breading. No chicken included.
2. Smoked salmon
3. Duck enchiladas - this was my least favorite
4. Mac n cheese

The food was ok. Nothing memorable. Drinks were good and memorable. Our service was satisfactory. Would i come back? Never. Go to Piccolo Sogno instead.

P.S.
I went to the restroom again before we left, and there were no paper towels.

I came here with a friend for a brunch! I made a reservation for Sunday  through Open Table!  We had a nice welcome and they sat us right away!
I love the decor and kind of modern style! And wooden pieces which is my fav! A+ for the style!
We both ordered egg benedicts with lobster, mimosas and a coffee. They were just ok but not the best tough! I wouldnt order it for the second time! The couple next to us got burgers and fries and even though I am not a burger person they looked amazing!!! So I will be back for sure just to try it!
Still loved the place and service was really nice too!
